content:
We've just been having a discussion on #zulip-terminal > UI Improvements about improving the spacing in our message view, which led to the idea of reshaping our recipient headers/bars - ie. the equivalent of the stream-pentagon + topic-text (or PM recipient(s)) in the webapp. Currently we have a full-height grey bar, which we've had for some time. @Kaustubh Nair came up with a white continuation line approach, and independently I came up with one with a colored line to match the stream color block. Do people have any thoughts on these different layouts?
new current
I think the colored line looks nicer.

One question on my mind is whether that vertical grey bar to the left of message content is placed properly:

image.png

I would have thought a ~4 space indentation at most would look nicer and leave more space for the message body in more narrow windows.

I think the colored line looks nicer.

This does seem to be becoming the consensus, but a wider sample is always good :)
Re vertical bar, this is currently indented to allow space for any '(EDITED)' text (like with this message now).
You could probably encode that with fewer characters or a symbol for ZT to make better use of space. (We use a smaller font size in the webapp).
I gave it a try just now - #T655.
The symbol serves the purpose of decreasing width, but it is really small on my screen. How about displaying '(EDITED)' before the timestamp? It won't eat up width there?
Also, this makes me think: what is the motivation behind having the vertical bar at all?
The 'EDITED' discussion is being continued on #zulip-terminal > EDITED marking #T655
